sentences.sContent: Languages are an essential part of the school curriculum.
sentences.sCn: 语言是学校课程中必不可少的部分。

sentences.sContent: ...What does the man say about the curriculum in Canadian universities...
...so there is the Ministry of Education in charge of creating the curriculum for the universities and so there is not much room for flexibility...
...Arum and Roksa placed the blame for students' lack of learning on a watered-down college curriculum and lowered undergraduate work standards...
...It's only because of the practicalities of education that you have to start breaking down the curriculum into specialist subjects...
...And faculty members will be wary of any change that threatens the core curriculum in the name of moving students into the workforce...
...This can be done both through the curriculum and through activities on campus outside of the classroom...

phrases.pCn: 隐性课程；潜在课程；隐蔽课程；非正式课程

trans.tranOther: the subjects that are taught by a school, college etc, or the things that are studied in a particular subject
